definition:
A *parent* node $P$ of a node $C$ in a tree is the first node which lies
along the path from $C$ to the root of the tree, $R$.

Drawn in the canonical root-at-top manner, the parent node of a node $C$
in a tree is simply the node immediately above $C$ which is connected to
it.

$$\xymatrix{
& \bullet \ar@{-}[dl] \ar@{-}[dr] & & & \\
\bullet & & {\color{red}\bullet} \ar@{-}[dr]\ar@{-}[dl] & & \\
& \bullet \ar@{-}[dl] & & {\color{blue}\bullet} & \\
\bullet & & & & }$$

[Figure: A node (blue) and its parent (red.)]{}
